values: Ya know when something major happens and instead of dealing with that, you focus all of your turmoil on something insignificant.  Yeah, so this post http://www.sunnyskyz.com/blog/526/All-Kids-Have-Picky-Eating-Habits-But-These-32-Toddlers-Take-The-Cake has PISSED ME OFF!  That, and doing grades, and worring about the downfall of human civilization, how education is broken, corporations rule the world and realizing I'm old.... The thing is with the post is I put myself in my grandma's shoes when I read that.  And instead of funny, it just seemed so sad and tragic.  DON'T get me wrong, I'm guilty of pandering to my 4 yr. old when she wanted to only eat blue things.  I am no better than the parents in this meme.  But the thing is, I'm also a high school teacher and have to deal with your lovely child who's been catered to and helicoptered over his/her whole life.  S/he's been told how perfect and special and wonderful s/he is their entire life.  S/He's come to expect mommy/daddy to work tirelessly every moment of every day to ensure that they have s/he has every moment planned and filled with entertainment and gogurt.  "Will there be snacks?" is the first things HS students ask when deciding if/which club meeting to attend.  Not the content, or what it's doing, or even who's in the club.  Just, is there food?  And if not the student scoffs and leaves.  My generation are some of the shittiest and best parents yet.  Some of us are great, raising kids without the violence or prejudice many of us were raised with.  And bullying, nothing like when I was a kid.  I still remember in Jr. High, SN making so much fun of my pizza face and telling me infront of band class how ugly I was and that no one really likes me they just feel bad for me because I had so many zits that she'd be old by the time she counted them all.  Everyone laughed and that was that.  Yes I realize the cliche of a pimpled faced band geek, but I own that baby, flute fah LYFE!  :)  Mr. Silvey did nothing, just told her to sit down.  Now a days, there'd be interventions and conferences and such, possibly a 504 or a behavior contract.  Kids today hide their bullying on the anonoymous feeling interwebs.  Never-the-less, it's nowhere as evident in the classroom as it was in the 80's. If my brother got in trouble, my mom didn't even want to HEAR his side, to her it didn't matter - you don't fuck with the teacher.  Whatever the teacher says is law.  Now.... hubby who teaches COLLEGE get's parents calling him pleading their student's cases.  It's the opposite swing of the pendulum.  So many of us are now parents who are frought with anxiety about being the BEST parent most loved by their children.  I remember my grandma feeding me fish, even though I'm allergic because she thought I might have outgrown it.  Some will read that and gasp in horror, others will give a little snort.  And that my friend is the difference between parents of my generation.  Now I'm not advocating putting your children in anaphatic shock, but that lady (my gma) grew up with 15 brothers and sisters.  She got married and didn't tell her parents, just went on like everything was normal until they read it in the paper.  She spent her entire  pregnancy and gave birth to her first child all by her self while her hubby was off fixing planes in Africa during WWII.  She was an actual Rosie the Rivitor.  She was fire and grit and determination.  She was intelligence beyond compare and filled with loyalty and love for her family, always seeing the good in things.  She wasn't just a survivor, she thrived.  She believed in the good in people.  She grew up in a different time so it made total sense to her that I could have outgrown the allergy.  (fyi I didn't hehe)  But the thing is, your child didn't do shit all semester and so please stop trying to blame me and make me change the grade because your lovely child is perfect.  Make them do their homework!  Get on their ass!  Take their freaking phone away.  Spend your energy being a good parent and not a shitty one who tries to blame the teacher for "not liking your kid."  I have NEVER EVER EVER failed a kid because I didn't like them.  Nor do I know of a teacher who has.  Does it exist, I'm sure it does somewhere.  Just like with every job, there are good doctors and shitty doctors, but you can't assume that becuase you've had one shitty doctor that all doctors suck.  It's the same damn thing with teaching.  We're doing the best we fucking can.  We WANT your child to be successful.  We get so freaking excited when your lovely kid does well.  Even after they've called us a fucking whore.  Just like you love your child even after they say that to you.  It's in our nature.  Damn it to Hell I wish it wasn't, but it is.  So please trust me, your lovely kid needs you to stop picking the breading off of every single piece of chicken nuggets EVER SINGLE TIME just to get him to eat something.  Let him "starve" for dinner, let him throw that tantrum and throw his ass in his room until he decides to be human.  Why?  Because we don't need a shitty generation of self-entitled, narcissictic, pseudo-adults who don't know how to be human. Also, my grandma died and left me a journal of her "life lessons" and memories and my car died and left me nothing but I have a new nephew Jayden who is perfect and I taught my other nephew Wyatt how to do some ballet Life is funny

So I just found out that I'm diabetic.  It's no surprise, looking in the mirror I know I'm not "me".  I haven't been for years.  And for years, I've gone back and forth losing the same 10lbs, but nothing more.  I've known that what I eat is horrible, not so much the quantity, but the quality.  And I've always told myself that if I just buckled down, I'd lose the weight and once (fill in the blank) is over, then I'll really hit it hard.  Only there was always something else.  Some other holiday or event or work stress.  And so here i sit, fat and sick.  My brain is telling me that this is a blessing in disguise.  I'm now forced to eat real food and take care of myself, but emotionally I'm in a panic.  I can't stop crying.  I can't cry around my family because they're already worried and again.... my brain knows I'll be okay.  But all of a sudden I'm forced to deal with my relationship with food.  When I was young and thin and a dancer, I ate what I wanted when I wanted and never thought twice.  Food wasn't a source of joy or pain.... it was simply food.  But now, I realize how much I try to get joy from food.  How I use it as my reward for dealing with the stresses of being a HS teacher, a mother to a teenager, a wife.  It sounds horrible, but one of my first thoughts was, "how can I be happy if I can't eat anything 'good?"  I imagined coming home and having to prepare something that simply isn't as awesome as junky, sweet, fattening food and it overwhelmed me.  Yet ANOTHER thing I have to worry about/do.  For many this would make no sense.  Even to my brain I know it's illogical, but to the emotional, irrational part of me, it strikes fear down to my core.  Again, don't get me wrong, in the scheme of the world I know it's not a big deal, but in terms of self-reflection, it's a huge deal.  How did I get to this point of using food as a way to feel "happy"?  The change was so gradual I couldn't pinpoint its inception and I never really put a face on it until this moment.  Tomorrow I will be fine, I'll adjust and make changes that will be better for my health.  But right now, in this moment, I can't visualize it.  I feel like a 2 yr old who just lost their blankie.  And I'm angry and scared, but without anyone other than myself to direct it towards.  Which just sucks.

Personal Evolution has been weighing on my mind.  Boo's growing up.  I know parents always say that, but she really is.  She's going to be in jr. high next year.  She's already off spending the night at friends and doing all sorts of wonderful things without me.  It's such a double edged sword.  I love that we moved out here and she took too it so well.  She's blossomed so much, but at the same time I have to continuously confront the reality of the situation - she is growing up and on.  I've done my job well, but I don't know how parents do it - I don't know how they watch their babies go off in a car - driving - or away to college - or off on some far away adventure.  For so long it was just her and I.  And even when hubby came in, i've given so much of myself to that role of "mom" that I forget what it was like without that.  And now, as she's growing away on her own I'm finding that I need to re-define myself.  Remember who I was, who I am aside from being "mom."  I have to find a way to not get depressed when she spends the night at a friends house ya know.  It's just crazy how in truth, we need our children so much more than they need us.  Hopefully she'll go to Berkeley or Santa Clara and not live far away :)

I quit my job
yep - for the first time since I was like 14 I quit a job without either moving or having a different/better job to go to.  I'd go into the why's - but it'd take too long and I'm simply over it by now.  Let's just say it was a bad situation and I finally stood up for myself which was SCARY AS HELL at the time, but now - I feel empowered!  Thank god for my hubby and bff - they totally had my back.  There's just something about your peeps being there for you that can make everything all good again.  Through this I've realized how much I've been holding myself back.  For example - me going back to school.  Everyone's always told me i needed to go to grad school but I'd always come up with some excuse as to why I couldn't do it and the truth of the matter was that I was scared.  Scared I wasn't smart enough to hack it.  Scared that I wouldn't be able to get in or if I did I wouldn't be able to come up with something "new and original."  But it all boiled down to the same thing.  Scared.  It's funny, I'd go to medical school before I'd go get my ph.d in something like history or soc.  To me that stuff is easy.  Sure you have to memorize a lot of crap, but memorizing is a hell of a lot easier than unique abstract thinking.  I mean, what if I couldn't come up with anything good.  But after a lot of soul searching I finally realized that getting a ph.d was what I REALLY want to do.  And ya know what, I might flunk out, I might reach a plateau and never overcome it, but at least I will have tried and if I don't, it's always going to hang over my head.  I think about bella and the advice that I'd give her in the same situation "go for your dreams" and if I don't set that example for her, where's she gonna get it?  Anyway, so that's the plan :)

In the mean time I've taken an awesome vacay to Oregon and had a very strange encounter with a bag full of dildo's and a crazy friend of a friend which made me appreciate the fact that I've grown up.  It's amazing when you see people who are stuck in the same drama as they were 10 years ago and don't understand why things are the way they are.  I just ran into that with my ex who's broken up with his latest gfriend.  I was actually hoping that would work out for him, but sure enough - same ole same ole.  I can pretty much say that about most of my ex's which in hindsight makes me realize that it wasn't ALL me.  But it's interesting to look at bff and I.  I mean, statistically we had everything going against us.  We were the after school special that you'd watch...... uh ..... after school.  And yet, we've both come so far.  She's grown with every relationship and experience.  She went for her dream and now has a MA to show for it.  She moved to the place she always wanted to, is responsible and amazing and well, frankly turned out pretty damn well.  I'd say the same (for the most part) about myself.  Yet we both had to put up with crazy alcoholics, abuse, poverty - you name it.  But I look at my ex and the friend of a friend - both come from normal, loving middle class families and yet they can't seem to escape their own dysfunctions.  I'm sounding judgemental and I don't want to.  Instead what I took from it all was a sense of gratefullness about my own life.  I believe that a lot of it was luck.  I couldn't tell you why I'm where I am.  I never thought I would be.  To ramble on even more about this, my mom complimented me yesterday about what a good parent I was (which was funny to me cuz bella was being a brat).  I just didn't know what to say to it - I've talked about this before - there was little "planning" that went into the raising of my daughter, it was more a feeling of survival, and yet......she rocks.  Again, I'm grateful as hell.

But back to portland - bff's friends are amazing!  We had so much fun, but to me one of the highlights was Powell's books!  OMG I could live there!  We spent 4 hrs. there and I feel like I barely scratched the surface.  After checking out about 25lbs of books I realized I bought the majority for bella hahaha.  But she's in heaven!  Her big thing is historical fiction so I got her all sortsa books in that genre.  I love that she's a reader!  Spending time with bff was just amazing.  I have to live close to her.  She's such a part of me.  I truly believe that few people have the type of friendship that we have.  I was awesome telling stories of us growing up.  We realized that at one time or another we each saved each other.  I've known her for 20 years now.  Crazy huh!  No matter where we are or what we're going through - it seems like not a day has passed since we last saw each other.  I'm totally looking forward to living within driving distance of her.

And now my folks are out for a visit.  We're doing all the touristie things and having a blast.  I actually went "antiquing" today.  Never done that before.  Well, unless you count thrift stores :)  I had SO MUCH FUN!!  I never knew I'd like that!  It makes sense though, the history nut in me.  It was a bummer though because I couldn't justify getting anything since we're moving soon.  But I'm definatly going to drag Jensen to that :)  

So I have about a week left of "vacation" and then it's nose to the grindstone to get things together for the move - mainly a job!  I've realized I just don't want to teach for a while so I think I'm going to be looking for something else.  I don't think people realize how degrading teaching can be.  Not always, I mean I've been in situations where it wasn't, but people are so critical, administration is so critical, and the public in general.  It's always about what you're not doing or how you're doing it wrong, yet no one will tell you a "right" way to do things.  There's a million different teaching philosophies and so many of them conflict.  You're told that EVERY CHILD must pass a test, but they won't tell you what's on the test, but if EVERY KID doesn't not just pass, but do exceptionally well then you must be doing something wrong.  No one tells a dr. that EVERY PATIENT must survive cancer and if they don't the dr. is doing something wrong.  It's sad, but you can always recognize a teacher by their haggard look and teacher clothes.  Every teacher I know has put on weight, has health problems and is just generally a stressed out nightmare.  That just shouldn't happen.  Teachers should be respected and honored.  You may deal with your one crazy child, they deal with 30 - all day long.  And I LOVE my kid, she's an amazing child, but all day 30 of them, they have enough to deal with with that alone, but then you add everything else on top of it and it's no wonder they're haggard and exhausted.  No matter how much you love your job, when it beats the hell out of you day in and day out you begin to wonder.  Teachers rarely stick up for themselves either.  We're "in it for the kids" so we put up with all the other crap because we think we have to.  We lose our voice and allow ourselves to be treated poorly because often we don't know any better and if we do, we feel that our one voice won't make a difference.  There's an established hierarchy of power that exists in education that's so difficult to change.  Everyone's afraid .... afraid a parent will complain, afraid test scores will suck, afraid that they'll be laid off as so many teachers are, afraid if they complain they'll be put in a worse situation, given more students in a class, forced to teach something you don't want.  So instead we bite our tongues and bide our time hoping that we'll be able to get the smaller class, teaching the content we want, making the parents happy enough that they don't pick apart everything you do.  It's a shame because in the end things become so watered down that kids aren't benefitting at all.  I would say it's much better at a high school level, but it does still exist there.

I'm bored.  I hate to say that since I don't have to work due to my inability to safely roll a cart with a tv, but I have to admit... I'm bored.  If I had some decent drugs it might make my time off rather interesting, but sadly, nothing more than hyped up asprin.  So what have I been doing you might ask..... playing a whole lot of free cell, reading blog posts from my friend written by her "cat" who's a Canadian transplant, and watching a shit load of HGTV and DIY network.  Normally that would be awesome, but it makes me want to build things which is sorta a problem since 1) I'm a gimp at the moment and 2) I don't have any tools.  But ohhh do I have plans hahaha.  I've already made my Christmas list:
1) nail gun - that's just GOT to be fun to use!!  Hell I think I could build an entire house with just a nail gun and some tunes.  
2) jig saw - every show I watch they need a jig saw somehow somewhere.
3)  wood glue - why, because with wood glue you can fix anything, it's the equivalent of duct tape it seems
4) a house in which to do all of my projects

So then of course I begin thinking about how cool it'd be to become a contractor.  Granted I hate mornings, and am a bit of a wimp physically, but in my mind that wouldn't be a problem.  I'd be this super talented chica who could fix anything.  An then I dream about going back to school to "learn the trade"  which ones?  all of them.  Except I'm not really sure where one would go to learn things.  I mean is there like an "intro to construction" class?  I'd need something basic ie:  this is a hammer and the differences between flathead and phillips head screwdrivers.  It's funny, I grew up around construction but never seemed to learn much - though I can tile like a mofo.  My grandpa was a builder and even to this day at the ripe ole age of 85 he helps family members do additions and build homes etc.  My mom continued on in an unofficial mannor, usually involving weekend projects that required us to get up at some ungodly hr.  Our house is rather impressive now - all done by her and the family.  I really think i'd like to take a class to learn more, just not sure where to start.  Plus not having a home of my own to work on sorta takes all the fun out of it.

This time off has given me the luxury of daydreaming again though and that's rather nice.  It seems like the latest thing, coming up with some list of things you want to do before you die - so I've been mentally creating some of my own.  See hubby should be done with his ph.d. in about a year and our deal is when he's done and teaching somewhere I get to go back to school.  I have to say, the though both excites and scares the hell out of me.  It's like I have a chance of a do-over and that's sooooo rare to have.  I never thought I'd be in that position.  Before the thoughts of going back to school entailed figuring out how to support myself AND mini-me while going to school.  No easy task I assure you, but now, that's a real possibility and I don't want to waste it!  I never went into medicine because I thought I wasn't smart enough, I'm still not too sure I am, but maybe I should just try?  I don't know.  I don't want to let anyone down ya know.  All I know is that I want out of education.  Sure, I can do it till retirement, but i just ....... it just literally sucks the life out of you.  I want to help people, I'm all idealistic and crap where I want my life to somehow contribute to some cosmic greater good, but I know that every career has its down sides and I want to find one that I enjoy going to every day.  One where I can see my "work" if that makes sense.  Maybe building things would be a good path.  And then this other side of me thinks about finding a job where I put in my 8hrs. a day, go home and not have to think about it again till the next day.  That's what I loved about being a secretary - it was easy for me, I'm an organizational bitch!  Maybe I should go into human resources or something and get an office job where I don't have to worry about anything.  But would that be giving up somehow?  Then I think of dentistry - please refrain from laughing!  It's in the medical field, but doesn't require 10 years of schooling.  Hmmm decisions decisions.

Tonight bella said I was a "supermom"  it made me smile :)  It's so hard for me to give myself any credit when it comes to raising her, like I said before.... she just sorta turned out the way she is - i'm not exactally sure how but i never gave it much thought - raising her that is.  What I mean by that is there are many a parent out there that gives raising their kids THOUGHT.  Most everything they do is a conscious effort.  They analyze the overall GOOD of allowing their child to read a certain book or watch a program.  They make sure to have them involved in the RIGHT activities.  They play classical music while their child is in the womb.  They make sure that veggies are eaten and that dinner is had at a table and at a set time.  They spend money on baby einstein stuff and plan "craft time" with the kids and all that junk.  They debate on the proper phrasing of things making sure to correct in a positive "It would be a better choice to share with your brother instead of hitting him with your toy"  rather than the "what the hell is wrong with you stop hitting your brother in the head with your toy." 

 Don't get me wrong, I'm not bagging on that.  I wanted to be that parent, it just didn't turn out that way.  I tell my child she's annoying me.  She lives on microwavable food, and as long as she's not bugging me I don't care what she watches.  I will admit to playing classical music to her as a baby when she went to sleep.  Maybe that was the thing which made her how she is now hahaha. 

 It's just being a mom is tiring business.  They talk to you ALL THE TIME.  You rarely get to pee without having a voice on the other side of the door asking you for something.  They argue over if they should be allowed to dye their hair and if so at what age.  No matter what age you say, they've got to try to negotiate down to something younger.  Everything is "why...why... or why not..."  Then you have to feed them.  And you should probablly let them do things like play and do stuff like gymnastics or soccer or whatever all of which require time taking them here or there.  Tiring.  And then there's the homework.  Lord help me.  Last minute projects where you have to run to the store and get eggs to hardboil so they can compare it to regular eggs.  At 8pm at night.  Oh yeah, don't forget to get cookies and candy for the party on thursday.  Oh and while your at it i need to buy a shirt for the mini-olympics at school so i'm not the only one wearing the uniform.  oh and watch me do a one handed cartwheel....wait, that wasn't good, let me do another.....hang on one more........

I love Louisiana.  I love where I live - 1/2 hr. from Baton Rouge one way and 1/2 hr from New Orleans the other.  Two totally different cities but both indescribably cool.

I've been going to LA for 3 yrs. now - each time spending time in both cities.  I love NO so much.  I can't describe the intense flavors of culture there.  It's always been a unique city - politically and socially.  It's unlike any city I've been to.  I loved spending time down there not just in the French Qtr., but everywhere.  

And then Katrina hit.  I cried my eyes out watching what happened the days after the hurricane.  Watching a mother with a baby who's dying of dehydration.  The disbelief.  It angered me so deeply how the poor were simply left to die almost.  Hearing people bitch about how these people should've just left blah blah which anyone with a brain knows that's just bullshit.  The sociological commentary afterwards sums it up - my feelings aren't unique about this so I won't bother reiterating what so many others have said.

But what angers me more is the aftermath.  It broke my heart to see it.  Such beauty destroyed.  Even today it looks like a war zone. I've never in my life seen anything like it.  Streets and streets of gutted houses.  Abandoned buildings which have now been overtaken by those who've been left homeless as a result.  I can't even describe it.  What's worse is every night watching the news - the violence - the looting still goes on every day.  So many people are dying there - killing each other.  People are having a hell of a time re-building because of looting.  And then the world becomes crazy to me.  The self-destructiveness of it all.  Instead of tragedy bringing people closer it's turned everyone against each other.  There are no jobs.  There are no houses for those displaced.  There is little that people can do to pull themselves outta their desperation.  Few hospitals, schools are extremely overcrowed since a lot of them haven't opened yet.  Businesses aren't coming back.  Insurance is through the roof.  Prices are insane.  People have given up.  And it leaves me so.........upset/sad.  Still neglected.  Still left to die in a sense.  Those with money can and did leave.  And I wonder what's going to happen to this beautiful, unique city.  

Where did this come from?  I was sitting outside reading and I saw a storm come rolling in.  You could smell it in the air.  Us desert rats have an uncanny ability to smell the rain long before it arrives, perhaps because rain was such a luxury out there.  I remember as a child sitting outside during monsoon season.  Feeling the electricity in the air.  The hot rain as it poured down in big droplets.  Crazy wind.  I felt myself wrapped around the storm and for some reason it was so..........comforting.

But after living here even the little bit I have, storms have become......different.  Ominous as the winds begin to blow through the trees.  Angry nature.  Not that I'm afraid of a hurricane or anything like that,  but ........it's different now and I wonder if I'll ever feel that awe of an oncoming storm like I use to.  

I miss the desert storms.  That celebration of much needed rain.  The beauty of it whirling around you.

He's always been afraid of marriage.  I understand to a degree.  Yet he moved foreward with leaps and bounds.  He came into my life, into bella's life and was amazing.  The only thing that ever hung over us was that no-mans-land of undefined future.  It wasn't that I had to get married.  I just needed to know that he was in this since he'd become such a part of our lives.  And so for three years it went.

There were moments, when he was off meds and depressed.  He was so successful in life, such a "good guy" but he never believed too much in himself and was always looking for someone to tell him that he was amazing.  But after hearing it so much from me I guess it lost its power.  There'd be emails to old girlfriends, but I'm guilty of the same.  Yet it made me feel so insecure.  We'd argue about our future - break up for two hours and then he'd be back in tears telling me he wanted me in his life forever.  He'd always say that.  Never was there any words from him insinuating that he wanted to leave - it was always just his fear of the future.  His fear that I'd eventually hate him, we'd grow distant and he'd be in a loveless marriage.  Nothing I said could console him.  Yet except for those moments, everything was great.  Future plans, trips, family better than many marriages.

When he left for DC and I for LA it was hard.  Distance was not good for us, me being insecure and him finding himself in the midst of a huge depression.  Things happened that I quesitoned.  We fought more and more about the same thing.  It was so hard knowing that were we back in Fay.  none of this would've happened.  But we weren't.  It's funny, before he told me he'd been adamant about bringing the romance into our relationship at such a distance.  See we're both contact people.  That's the best I can explain it.  We don't need to do flowers and gifts, we're cuddle on the couch and watch tv people.  Fuck on a sat afternoon then nap people.  Footsies and cuddles while falling asleep people and to not be able to have that because of the distance threw everything into whack for both of us.  So he'd even come up with a list of things that he was going to do to show the love. 

Then Friday night came and I didn't hear from him.  He'd gone out with some friends that were getting ready to deploy.  He'd been drinking since being in DC which was odd as he'd drink maybe a beer every few months max.  He'd gone out with friends up there before and always would call me to let me know he got in safe because I worry.  He didn't call.  I called before I went to bed.  No answer.  The next day, no messages from him.  In all the 3 yrs. we'd been together never had a day passed that he hadn't called.  Never.  The hair on my arms stood straight up.  I tried calling him again, but no answer.  Then he finally called while I was driving home from the store.  I could tell by the sound of his voice he was ashamed.  It's amazing how you know a person inside and out after living with them for a while.  Then he told me

We talked eventually.  and talked and talked and talked.  he consoled me and apologized.  When he came home I couldn't even look at him.  He cried and cried.  The next time I saw him, he cried when he saw me.  We talked more.  He was beating himself up more than I ever could.  He was weak and that's what he does.  He makes it so I can never take him back.  But I did.  In a way.  I agreed to try to work through this. But it didn't work.  I was so sensitive about everything that all I could do was argue with him. 

So I started dating.  It was weird and not right and didn't last long at all.  I missed him more than I could handle.  Talking to him every night when he called bella just broke me apart.  So I told him I was willing to try again.  Then it was he that was distant.  And for the first time with him I felt like it was I who was begging him to come back.  and it was so humiliating.  But nothing had changed.  He wanted me in his life, but on his terms.  We went to DC to snowboard, it was amazing, just like old times, but once home....back to our dance of uncertainty.  Interperting words.  Hypersensitivity on both sides. 

I felt a million miles away from him and it hurt so much.  He kept me at arms length.  And it killed me.  But we were "trying."  I felt so lost, but he kept trying to reassure me, but i sensed his heart wasn't in it.  But his words kept coming.  What to believe.  What do I want.  I was lost in confusion.  Then the last conversation we had when I asked him if he missed ME he answered, "sure I miss you guys."  so i laughed my, "jerk" laugh and he said, "what wasn't that the right answer?"  Knowing that we didn't have time to talk since his 10 min. was almost up I said, "it's fine, we miss you too."  And then he was gone. 

Today, the mail came.  Bella got two letters from him.  I got nothing.  He's never said that it's over.  He's said he wasn't sure, that things are so hard because of him.  That he knows he's hurting me and he hates it.  But when I question if we should even try he says we should.  He ALWAYS says we should. And at times I feel so angry at him.  At what he took from me ya know.  Like he stole something important.  How I'll never cuddle/watch tv with him.  Or fall asleep as he rubs my back.  How we'll never go snowboarding or laugh at silly things bella did.  He was my best friend (besides kt of course haha) and he stole my best friend from me.  And now that friend is forever gone.  It'll never be like it was.  And I don't care that things will get better, and that we'll end up friends, and that maybe it wasn't meant to be, and someday...blah blah blah.  Fuck that.  He stole my best friend.  He stole my future fond memories of him and I.  He hurt me.  And I'm SOOOOOOOOOOO tired of this re-run.  I want my family back.  I want my old Johnny back.  I want my best friend back.  And fuck him for taking that all away from me.

For some reason it struck me as interesting that we celebrate New Years.  Warning:  everything Im about to say has most likely been said/contemplated before.  Im not laying claim to any enlightening insight at all but here goes.

 

So obviously we have 365 days in a year thus any day could be considered the start and its merely the passage of a particular number of days which marks New Years.  And we all know that the current standard calendar isnt the one and only universal truth of all truths calendar.  Why do we do it?  Why do we all gather together to watch a ball, kiss at a certain time, drink excessively, promise to be good next year etc etc

 

Then it dawned on me our societys lack of traditions and rituals to mark time and stages of life.  It use to be the pivotal aspect of a culture the rituals.  These things determined if you were a man or not, when to marry, your relationship with God(s), how smart you were, how deserving or brave or whatever.  We dont do that much any more.  We have birthdays to mark years, but weve already begun to blur the concept of adolescents, adulthood, childhood when you see a 7 yr. old wearing heels and makeup and a 35 yr. old living at home mooching off of the rents.  You have to be a certain age to see a violent movie, but you can get online and watch all the porn you want regardless of your age as long as you check yes Im 18 as if those who are going to download porn are held to a higher moral standard of honesty (not that Im downing porn, but yall know what my point is).

 

Anyway, so we have melted our rituals together, bastardized the meaning of much of it and lost a great deal of others.  I firmly believe that cultures need ritual to function smoothly.  I havent worked out exactly why, but it seems to me like it adds purpose even if its culturally biased. 

 

This leads me to New Years.  Its a new beginning and especially in our country we love the idea of new beginnings.  We love to believe the pulling ourselves up from our bootstraps idea.  Regardless of where we are today, if we try, if we put forth enough effort and determination, next year we can do it.  Make it.  Whatever that elusive goal is, we can achieve it because regardless of our past failures, we can leave that behind us and start over.  Were a video game society and New Years is our reset button.  Im not going to debate the actual reality of this actually happening, but it seems very appropriate.  We love interventions, and extreme makeovers, and rags to riches stories.  New Years is a promise, its hope, its our chance to believe in ourselves again.  Maybe, just maybe this year I can actually do it.. save that extra money, lose that 15lbs, find the perfect job, spend more time with my (fill in the blank).  We havent failed yet in this New Year.  Last night J. and I welcomed in the New Year with a good fuck.  Afterwards he says, so far this is the best year of my life.  It made me laugh because its exactly what Im talking about.  Sure theres only been a hr. or so of the yr. but the sum of the yr. at that point was the best in that there hasnt been a chance to fuck the yr. up yet.

 

We judge the upcoming yr. by our 1st few hrs. of it.  I do that all the time.  I get the same feeling I get when I gamble.  This gut clenching, mental fingers crossed hoping that it come out in my favor.  I think some of us do that with New Years.  Its rarely an appreciation of the past yr. but rather a wish for the new one.

 

Im not saying this is a bad thing.  Once again I go back to my belief that society needs ritual.  Im just saying that its interesting our view of this ritual especially because as the days slowly pass we often become more and more disenchanted as we quickly begin to fail to keep our resolutions.  I wonder if this has anything to do with how people tend to be the most depressed in Jan. and Feb.  as were quickly finding were unable to keep the promises we made to ourselves and if we cant keep the promises we make to ourselves how can we expect others to keep their promises to us? 

 

New Years finds us making all sorts of wishes about what were going to do differently.  How were going to change.  How everything is going to be better.  I wonder if itd be better if we were to think about all the exciting things that are going to happen.  I know that sounds like the same thing but Im thinking more along the lines of what we know.  I know that this year there will be a time when I laugh so hard I cry.  I know that there will be tons of instances where I feel completely and totally loved by J. and B.   I know that Im probably going to read at least one pretty good book.  Im most likely going to go somewhere that Ive never been before.  Ill have a moment at work when Ill feel like Im doing a great job.  Ill get to watch B. perform in something and be so proud that I feel like Im going to burst.  Theres birthdays and anniversaries and holidays all of which will have to result in at least SOME good moments.  Ill have awesome conversation with friends, Ill even do something that Im proud of at least once this year.  All these things happen every year regardless of how shitty the year has been.  Yeah yeah, Im being sickly optimistic right now, theres a ton of bad shit thatll happen too leaving me feeling defeated but what can I say, I started the year with a fuck, its so far been the best year Ive ever had
